author: XuPengfei-1020
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
1. type a word: hello
2. type ctrl + w
```

# Expected behavior
the world hello should be deleted.
```none

```

# Actual behavior
ctrl + w -> ^w
```none

```
![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14899806/83253973-82f40d80-a1e0-11ea-8fca-39cd79072cd1.png)

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.18362.752
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.18362.752
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: vexx32
XuPengfei-1020
comments.body:
> 
> 
> Can you also test whether the same occurs if you unload PSReadLine? (`Remove-Module PSReadLine` and re-test).
> 
> Thanks! 😊
Environment data has updated, thinks for your help.

Nothing chenged after run `Remove-Module PSReadLine` (ctrl + w still does not work as expected).

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Not sure what's really going on there, but PS 5.1 isn't maintained in this repo; you might be better off asking on one of the community channels ([Slack](//aka.ms/psslack)/[Discord](//aka.ms/psdiscord)).

If I had to guess, I'd say that probably the shortcut you're using isn't supported by the terminal you're running PowerShell in -- the fact that the behaviour is the same with and without PSReadLine indicates that none of PS's usual input handling is affecting it whatsoever and most likely the terminal is intercepting the chord instead.

Are you running in Windows Terminal?

comments.author: XuPengfei-1020

title: Ctrl + w can not delete a word, instead of, ^w.
